review_blob: On tap at the Provincial Geraldton, served with moderate head, a cloudy light malt colour with a hint of green. I can see why they named it. Almost no aroma just a hint of chamomile. Tastes of lemon and pinapple fruit flavours on top of a light malt base. Softly finishes with also light and dry bitterness. A nice drinkable beer but not one you would boast about.
